com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.discovery.v1

Class Discovery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service.WatsonService
      • com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.discovery.v1.Discovery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollectionManager, ConfigurationManager, DocumentManager, EnvironmentManager, QueryManager

    public class Discovery
extends WatsonService
implements EnvironmentManager, ConfigurationManager, CollectionManager, DocumentManager, QueryManager
    Discovery service API for CRUD operations for indexing and searching data.

      • deleteConfiguration

        public ServiceCall<DeleteConfigurationResponse> deleteConfiguration(DeleteConfigurationRequest deleteRequest)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationManager
        Deletes an existing configuration. The delete is performed unconditionally. A configuration delete request will succeed even if the configuration is referenced by a collection or document ingestion. However, documents which have already been submitted for processing will continue to use the deleted configuration (documents are always processed with a snapshot of the configuration as it existed at the time the document was submitted).
        Specified by:
        deleteConfiguration in interface ConfigurationManager
        Parameters:
        deleteRequest - options for deleting the configuration
        Returns:
        a DeleteConfigurationResponse containing the result of the DeleteConfigurationRequest

      • updateConfiguration

        public ServiceCall<UpdateConfigurationResponse> updateConfiguration(UpdateConfigurationRequest updateRequest)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationManager
        Replaces an existing configuration. - Completely replaces the original configuration that was here before. - The 'configuration_id', 'updated', and 'created' fields accepted in the request, but they are ignored (an error is not generated). It is also acceptable for users to submit an updated config with none of the three properties. - Documents are processed with a snapshot of the configuration as it was at the time the document was submitted to be ingested. This means that already submitted documents will not see any updates made to the configuration.
        Specified by:
        updateConfiguration in interface ConfigurationManager
        Parameters:
        updateRequest - options for updating the configuration
        Returns:
        a UpdateConfigurationResponse containing the result of the UpdateConfigurationRequest

      • createDocument

        public ServiceCall<CreateDocumentResponse> createDocument(CreateDocumentRequest createRequest)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentManager
        Starts ingesting a document with optional metadata and optional configuration overrides. Returns immediately after the system has accepted the document for processing. The user must provide document content, metadata, or both. If the request is missing both document content and metadata, then it will be rejected. User can set the Content-Type parameter on the file part to indicate the media type of the document. If the Content-Type parameter is missing or is one of the generic media types (e.g. application/octet-stream), then the service will attempt to automatically detect the document's media type.
        Specified by:
        createDocument in interface DocumentManager
        Parameters:
        createRequest - options for creating a Document
        Returns:
        a CreateDocumentResponse containing the details of CreateDocumentRequest

      • deleteDocument

        public ServiceCall<DeleteDocumentResponse> deleteDocument(DeleteDocumentRequest deleteRequest)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentManager

        Specified by:
        deleteDocument in interface DocumentManager
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a DeleteDocumentResponse containing the details of DeleteDocumentRequest

      • updateDocument

        public ServiceCall<UpdateDocumentResponse> updateDocument(UpdateDocumentRequest updateRequest)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentManager
        Starts ingesting a source document to create or replace an existing document. This is a POST operation instead of a PUT operation because an existing document may be partially updated, depending on whether or not the new, replacement document is successfully ingested (see the next bullet for details). - If a document already exists with the provided Document ID, then the fate of the original document depends on whether or not the new document is successfully ingested - If the new document fails, then the original document is left intact in the collection's index. However, any previous notices (warnings or errors) that were stored for the original document are replaced with the new document's notices. - If the new document is successfully processed, then the original document is replaced with the new document in the collection's index, including any notices. - Only the document_id from the request path is used. If the user provides a document_id in the input document (assuming JSON is submitted), it will be ignored. Returns immediately after the system has accepted the document for processing. The user must provide document content, metadata, or both. If the request is missing both document content and metadata, then it will be rejected. User can set the Content-Type parameter on the file part to indicate the media type of the document. If the Content-Type parameter is missing or is one of the generic media types (e.g. application/octet-stream), then the service will attempt to automatically detect the document's media type.
        Specified by:
        updateDocument in interface DocumentManager
        Parameters:
        updateRequest - options for updating a Document
        Returns:
        a UpdateDocumentResponse containing the details of UpdateDocumentRequest

      • query

        public ServiceCall<QueryResponse> query(QueryRequest queryRequest)

        Executes a query.
        Specified by:
